get.summary: Hello
Available clusters
get.description: Get the list of clusters (available at a particular point in time)

get.summary: Partitions available in a given cluster
get.description: Get status of partitions of a cluster (for a specific time point)

schema.title: Response Partitions Cluster  Cluster  Partitions Get

get.summary: Nodes available in a given cluster
get.description: Get the list of node names in a cluster

schema.title: Response Nodes Cluster  Cluster  Nodes Get

get.summary: Node-specific error messages
get.description: Get error_message of a cluster (for a specific time point) (or nodes)

schema.title: Response Error Messages Cluster  Cluster  Nodes  Nodename  Error Messages Get

get.summary: Error messages collected for the entire cluster
get.description: Get error_message of a cluster (for a specific time point) (or nodes)

schema.title: Response Error Messages Cluster  Cluster  Error Messages Get

get.summary: Detailed information about a single node in a cluster
get.description:
Get available information about nodes in a cluster

It will only contain information about reporting nodes - in some case a node might exist in a cluster, but
not system information has been received yet. To check - compare with the complete node list /cluster/{cluster}/nodes

schema.title: Response Nodes Sysinfo Cluster  Cluster  Nodes  Nodename  Info Get

get.summary: Detailed information about nodes in a cluster
get.description:
Get available information about nodes in a cluster

It will only contain information about reporting nodes - in some case a node might exist in a cluster, but
not system information has been received yet. To check - compare with the complete node list /cluster/{cluster}/nodes

schema.title: Response Nodes Sysinfo Cluster  Cluster  Nodes Info Get

get.summary: Information about the state(s) of a specific nodes in a cluster
get.description: Get the state(s) of nodes in a given cluster

schema.title: Response Nodes States Cluster  Cluster  Nodes  Nodename  States Get

get.summary: Information about the states of all nodes in a cluster
get.description: Get the state(s) of nodes in a given cluster

schema.title: Response Nodes States Cluster  Cluster  Nodes States Get

get.summary: Topology information (as image/svg+xml) for a specific node in a cluster
get.description: Get the topology information for a node (if available)

get.summary: Get the timestamp of the last message received for each node in the given cluster
get.description:
Retrieve the last known timestamps of records added for nodes in the cluster

A timestamp of None (or null in the Json response) means, that no monitoring data has been recorded for this node.
In this case the node has probably no probe, i.e. sonar daemon running.

schema.title: Response Nodes Last Probe Timestamp Cluster  Cluster  Nodes Last Probe Timestamp Get

get.summary: Nodes Process Gpu Util
get.description: Retrieve the latest gpu utilization

get.summary: Nodes Process Gpu Util
get.description: Retrieve the latest gpu utilization

get.summary: Get **node**-related and **job**-related timeseries of GPU samples
get.description: Get node-related timeseries for processes running on gpu

get.summary: Nodes Sample Process Gpu
get.description: Get node-related timeseries for processes running on gpu

get.summary: Nodes Sample Process Gpu
get.description: Get node-related timeseries for processes running on gpu

get.summary: Get **job**-specific process (cpu/memory/gpu) timeseries data
get.description:
Get job-related timeseries for all processes running on cpu and gpu

By default this related to SLURM jobs (epoch set to 0).
To relate to non-SLURM jobs, provide the epoch as parameter to the query.

That will be separated in 'cpu_memory' and 'gpus'

schema.title: Response Job Sample Process System Cluster  Cluster  Jobs  Job Id  Process Timeseries Get

get.summary: Get all jobs process timeseries-data (cpu/memory/gpu) on a given cluster
get.description:
Get job-related timeseries for all processes running on cpu and gpu

By default this related to SLURM jobs (epoch set to 0).
To relate to non-SLURM jobs, provide the epoch as parameter to the query.

That will be separated in 'cpu_memory' and 'gpus'

schema.title: Response Job Sample Process System Cluster  Cluster  Jobs Process Timeseries Get

get.summary: Get GPU sample as timeseries aggregate for a specific job on a given cluster
get.description: Get job-related timeseries data for processes running on gpu

schema.title: Response Job Sample Process Gpu Timeseries Cluster  Cluster  Jobs  Job Id  Process Gpu Timeseries Get

get.summary: Get GPU samples as timeseries, aggregated per job (for all jobs) and process on a given cluster
get.description: Get job-related timeseries data for processes running on gpu

schema.title: Response Job Sample Process Gpu Timeseries Cluster  Cluster  Jobs Process Gpu Timeseries Get

get.summary: Get timeseries data of Memory samples for all nodes in a given cluster
get.description: Get node-related timeseries data for processes running on memory

schema.title: Response Nodes Process Cpu Memory Timeseries Cluster  Cluster  Nodes Memory Timeseries Get

get.summary: Get **node**-specific timeseries data of Memory samples
get.description: Get node-related timeseries data for processes running on memory

schema.title: Response Nodes Process Cpu Memory Timeseries Cluster  Cluster  Nodes  Nodename  Memory Timeseries Get

get.summary: Get timeseries data of CPU samples for all nodes in a given cluster
get.description: Get node-related timeseries data for processes running on memory

schema.title: Response Nodes Process Cpu Memory Timeseries Cluster  Cluster  Nodes Cpu Timeseries Get

get.summary: Get **node**-specific timeseries data of CPU samples
get.description: Get node-related timeseries data for processes running on memory

schema.title: Response Nodes Process Cpu Memory Timeseries Cluster  Cluster  Nodes  Nodename  Cpu Timeseries Get

Get **node**-specific timeseries data of GPU samples
Get jobs running on the given cluster

get.description: Get job information optionally limited by a given timeframe and output provided in a specified resolution of time

slurm.title: Slurm
slurm.description: Whether SLURM is in use (1) or not (0)

partitions.title: Partitions
partitions.description: List of available partitions in this cluster

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: List of available nodes in this cluster

node.title: Node
node.description: Name of the node (in the cluster)

time.title: Time
time.description: Time at which this error occurred

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.description: card-dependent, manufacturer's arch string, for NVIDIA this is 'Turing', 'Volta', etc.

cluster.title: Cluster
cluster.description: Name of the cluster that this GPU currently belongs to

node.title: Node
node.description: Name of the node that this GPU belongs to

index.title: Index
index.description: Local card index, may change at boot

address.title: Address
address.description: Indicates an intra-system card address, e.g., PCI adress

max_power_limit.title: Max Power Limit
max_power_limit.description: card-dependent, max power the card can draw in W(atts)

min_power_limit.title: Min Power Limit
min_power_limit.description: card-dependent: min power the card will draw in W(atts)

max_ce_clock.title: Max Ce Clock
max_ce_clock.description: card-dependent, maximum clock of compute element

max_memory_clock.title: Max Memory Clock
max_memory_clock.description: card-dependent, maximum clock of GPU memory

job_step.title: Job Step
job_step.description:
The step identifier for the job identified by job_id.  For the topmost step/stage of a job
        this will be the empty string.  Other values normally have the syntax of unsigned integers,
        but may also be the strings "extern" and "batch".  This field's default value is the empty
        string.

        NOTE: step 0 and step "empty string" are different, in fact thinking of a normal number-like
        step name as a number may not be very helpful.

job_state.title: Job State
job_state.description: State of the job, e.g., PENDING, RUNNING, FAILED (see SLURM Job States)

array_job_id.title: Array Job Id
array_job_id.description:
The overarching ID of an array job, see discussion in the postamble.

        sacct: the n of a `JobID` of the form `n_m.s`

        slurm: `JOB_INFO.array_job_id`.

array_task_id.title: Array Task Id
array_task_id.description:
if `array_job_id` is not zero, the array element's index.  Individual elements of an array
        job have their own plain job_id; the `array_job_id` identifies these as part of the same array
        job and the array_task_id identifies their position within the array, see later discussion.

        sacct: the m of a `JobID` of the form `n_m.s`.

        slurm: `JOB_INFO.array_task_id`.

het_job_id.title: Het Job Id
het_job_id.description: Id of the het(erogeneous) job (see SLURM documentation)

het_job_offset.title: Het Job Offset
het_job_offset.description: Unique sequence number (starting with 0) the het(erogeneous) job component (see SLURM documentation)

user_name.title: User Name
user_name.description: Name of the user that started the job

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Time at which the job started - only present if the job started

suspend_time.title: Suspend Time
suspend_time.description: Time the job was suspended in seconds

submit_time.title: Submit Time
submit_time.description: Time at which the job was submitted

time_limit.title: Time Limit
time_limit.description: Time limit for this job in seconds

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Time at which the job ended - only present if the job ended

exit_code.title: Exit Code
exit_code.description: Exit code of the job - given it has finished

partition.title: Partition
partition.description: Name of the partition this job is associated with

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: List of nodes that are requested by this job

requested_memory_per_node.title: Requested Memory Per Node
requested_memory_per_node.description: Requested memory in bytes per node

used_gpu_uuids.title: Used Gpu Uuids
used_gpu_uuids.description: UUIDs of GPUs that are actually used with this job - this might be different to the number of reserved GPUs (this a field computed by slurm-monitor)

NodeGpuTimeseriesResponse.title: NodeGpuTimeseriesResponse
NodeGpuTimeseriesResponse.description: List of timeseries data per GPU

os_release.title: Os Release
os_release.description: Name of the specific release of the operating system

memory.title: Memory
memory.description: Available memory in this node in KiB

partitions.title: Partitions
partitions.description: List of partitions that this node belongs to

states.title: States
states.description: State(s) this node is currently in

nodes_compact.title: Nodes Compact
nodes_compact.description: A compact representation of the list of nodes, e.g., n001,n002,n003 is n001-003

jobs_pending.title: Jobs Pending
jobs_pending.description: List of pending jobs in this partition (computed by slurm-monitor)

jobs_running.title: Jobs Running
jobs_running.description: List of running jobs in this partition (computed by slurm-monitor)

pending_max_submit_time.title: Pending Max Submit Time
pending_max_submit_time.description: Timestamp of the job being longest in PENDING state

running_latest_wait_time.title: Running Latest Wait Time
running_latest_wait_time.description: Waiting time in seconds of the most recent started job in this partition

total_cpus.title: Total Cpus
total_cpus.description: Total number of CPUs available in this partition

total_gpus.title: Total Gpus
total_gpus.description: Total number of GPUs available in this partition

gpus_reserved.title: Gpus Reserved
gpus_reserved.description: Total number of GPUs that are currently reserved in this partition

gpus_in_use.title: Gpus In Use
gpus_in_use.description: UUIDs of gpus that are currently in use in this partition

nodes_compact.title: Nodes Compact
nodes_compact.description: A compact representation of the list of nodes, e.g., n001,n002,n003 is n001-003

jobs_pending.title: Jobs Pending
jobs_pending.description: List of pending jobs in this partition (computed by slurm-monitor)

jobs_running.title: Jobs Running
jobs_running.description: List of running jobs in this partition (computed by slurm-monitor)

pending_max_submit_time.title: Pending Max Submit Time
pending_max_submit_time.description: Timestamp of the job being longest in PENDING state

running_latest_wait_time.title: Running Latest Wait Time
running_latest_wait_time.description: Waiting time in seconds of the most recent started job in this partition

total_cpus.title: Total Cpus
total_cpus.description: Total number of CPUs available in this partition

total_gpus.title: Total Gpus
total_gpus.description: Total number of GPUs available in this partition

gpus_reserved.title: Gpus Reserved
gpus_reserved.description: Total number of GPUs that are currently reserved in this partition

gpus_in_use.title: Gpus In Use
gpus_in_use.description: UUIDs of gpus that are currently in use in this partition

AllocTRES.title: Alloctres
AllocTRES.description: Allocated Trackable resources (TRES) (see SLURM Job Accounting)

ElapsedRaw.title: Elapsedraw
ElapsedRaw.description: The job's elapsed time in seconds (see SLURM Job Accounting)

SystemCPU.title: Systemcpu
SystemCPU.description: The amount of CPU time used by the job or job step. (see SLURM Job Accounting)

UserCPU.title: Usercpu
UserCPU.description: The amount of user CPU time used by the job or job step. (see SLURM Job Accounting)

AveVMSize.title: Avevmsize
AveVMSize.description: Average virtual memory size (see SLURM Job Accounting)

MaxVMSize.title: Maxvmsize
MaxVMSize.description: Maximum virtual memory size (see SLURM Job Accounting)

AveCPU.title: Avecpu
AveCPU.description: Average CPU usage (see SLURM Job Accounting)

MinCPU.title: Mincpu
MinCPU.description: Minimum CPU usage (see SLURM Job Accounting)

AveRSS.title: Averss
AveRSS.description: Average resident set size of all tasks in job (see SLURM Job Accounting)

MaxRSS.title: Maxrss
MaxRSS.description: Maximum resident set size of all tasks in job (see SLURM Job Accounting)

AveDiskRead.title: Avediskread
AveDiskRead.description: Average number of bytes read by all tasks in job (see SLURM Job Accounting)

AveDiskWrite.title: Avediskwrite
AveDiskWrite.description: Average number of bytes written by all tasks in job (see SLURM Job Accounting)

failing.title: Failing
failing.description: If not zero and error code indicating a card failure state. Code=1 is 'generic failure'. Other codes TBD

fan.title: Fan
fan.description: Percent of primary fan's max speed, max exceed 100% on some cards in some cases

compute_mode.title: Compute Mode
compute_mode.description: card-dependent, current compute mode if known

performance_state.title: Performance State
performance_state.description: Current performance level, card-specific >= 0, or unset for 'unknown'

ce_util.title: Ce Util
ce_util.description: Compute element capability used in percentage

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Card temperature a primar sensor in degrees Celsius (can be negative

data.title: Data
data.description: Timeseries of SampleGpu for this GPU

SampleGpuTimeseriesResponse.title: SampleGpuTimeseriesResponse
SampleGpuTimeseriesResponse.description:
Used GPU uuid and (local) index to identify the GPU and
provide the timeseries of samples

memory_resident.title: Memory Resident
memory_resident.description: Current resident memory usage in KiB

memory_virtual.title: Memory Virtual
memory_virtual.description: Current virtual memory usage in KiB

cpu_avg.title: Cpu Avg
cpu_avg.description: Average CPU utilization over the lifetime of the accumulated processes

cpu_time.title: Cpu Time
cpu_time.description: Total CPU time in seconds for the lifetime of the related processes

processes_avg.title: Processes Avg
processes_avg.description: Average number of processes running for this accumulated response

gpu_memory.title: Gpu Memory
gpu_memory.description: GPU Memory being utilized in KiB

pids.title: Pids
pids.description: Process ids related to an accumulated sample
